Q_DESC:
To write a program in singly linked list where the user inputs the number of the elements and inputs the eleements into the linked list. 
Now the user has to  singly linked list with every node having an additional arbitrary pointer that currently points to NULL. Need to make the arbitrary pointer point to the next higher value node.
A Simple Solution is to traverse all nodes one by one, for every node, find the node which has next greater value of current node and change the next pointer.

INPUT: 
4 number of elements
69 //first element
43 //second element
49 //third element
79 //fourth element
OUTPUT:
Traversal using Next Pointer
79, 45, 43, 69, 
Traversal using Arbit Pointer
43, 45, 69, 79,
TESTCASE_1:
4 69 43 45 79
###---###SEPERATOR---###---
Traversal using Next Pointer
79, 45, 43, 69, 
Traversal using Arbit Pointer
43, 45, 69, 79,
TESTCASE_2:
6 38 74 98 23 45 64
###---###SEPERATOR---###---
Traversal using Next Pointer
64, 45, 23, 98, 74, 38, 
Traversal using Arbit Pointer
23, 38, 45, 64, 74, 98,
